meanings.definition: An instrument used to detect and measure electric charges.
meanings.sent1: The electroscopes in the lab helped us find out if objects had electricity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use electroscopes to see if something has an electric charge.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to use the electroscopes to detect invisible magic.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like an electroscope, always sensing the hidden currents of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The electroscopes hummed with energy, revealing the secrets of the unseen world.

meanings.definition: Devices that can indicate the presence of an electric charge.
meanings.sent1: We used electroscopes to check if the wires were carrying electricity.
meanings.sent2: Electricians rely on electroscopes to detect hidden charges in circuits.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat mistook the electroscope for a toy and batted at it playfully.
meanings.sent4: His words were like electroscopes, revealing the charged emotions beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The electroscopes buzzed with excitement as they detected the invisible forces around them.
